Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When driving on an unlaned road, where should your vehicle be positioned?

Answers.Answer: Anywhere, so long as you can see what is coming
Close to the centre of the road
As close to the left side of the road as possible

Question: What is the safest way to drive up to intersections?

Answers.Answer: At such a speed that you can stop if you have to

Question: What is the maximum distance a load may extend in front of a car?

Answers.Answer: 2 metres from the front edge of the front seat
3 metres from the front edge of the front seat
4 metres from the front edge of the front seat
5 metres from the front edge of the front seat

Question: If you are driving at night with your vehicle headlights on high beam, when MUST you dip them?

Answers.Answer: Approaching a police officer on point duty

Question: To help you from being blinded by the headlights of an oncoming vehicle, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Look to the left-hand side of the road
Look to the right-hand side of the road
Look to the centre of the road
Turn the headlights of your vehicle onto high beam

Question: When must you signal that you are turning to the right?

Answers.Answer: Only if there are vehicles in front of you
3 seconds or more before you turn
Only if there are vehicles following behind you

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What must you do if glass falls on to the road from your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Sweep it up straight away if you can do so safely

You wish to turn left at the intersection. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up and turn in front of the cyclist
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stay back until the cyclist has passed the intersection
Keep driving to the next intersection

Question: When you have a learner licence you do not have to have it with you when you drive if your supervisor has their licence with them.
What does one or more yellow lights flashing at traffic signals mean?

Answers.Answer: Be careful and apply the give way rule
Drive on but increase your speed
Stop until the lights no longer flash
Move to the left-hand side of the road

What does this sign mean?

There is a rest area 50 metres ahead

Question: You are driving in a 100km/h speed area and you see an Accident sign. What speed must you slow down to?
Directions from a police officer overrule traffic signals, road signs and give way rules at an intersection.
When driving at night, which vehicle lights should you turn on?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If your car was first registered before 1 January 2000, you must renew its warrant of fitness every:
What does ‘the speed limit’ mean?

Answers.Answer: The slowest speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive in good conditions
The average speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive, except when overtaking

Question: At night, a towed vehicle must:

Answers.Answer: have a red light at the back

Question: When a flock of sheep are coming towards you on a country road, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Sound the horn on your vehicle to move them out the way
Slow down or pull over to the side of the road
Turn on your vehicle hazard lights and drive on
Drive down the centre of the road

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get around in front of the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stop and give way to the cyclist

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
Can you stop on a bus stop in a private motor vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Only if it is for less than 5 minutes

Question: Are you allowed to drive a vehicle with a load that is not tied on properly?

Answers.Answer: Yes – if you drive at less than 20km/h
Yes – if you put a white flag on the right-hand corner
Yes – if you think it will not come off the trailer
